intro: Jungia crenatifolia, commonly known as the serrated leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
